meanings.definition: Deserving of or having a certain value
meanings.sent1: The shiny gold coin was worthed to the collector.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was worthed a lot of money at the auction.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics were worthed by everyone in the family.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity truly worthed her a place in our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking sunset was worthed by all who witnessed its beauty.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she worthed the effort to clean the entire house.
meanings.sent2: He worthed a lot of praise for his hard work on the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat worthed a nap after chasing the laser pointer around the room.
meanings.sent4: The old book worthed a new cover to protect its pages.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner worthed every step towards the finish line.
